words.definition: To circulate something is to spread it quickly.
words.example: The fan helped to circulate cool air through the room.

words.definition: Consequent means happening because of a different situation.
words.example: Her consequent rash came after she touched the poison ivy.

words.definition: To derive something from another source means to get it from that thing.
words.example: Red's nickname was derived from the color of her hair.

words.definition: To drown is to die from not being able to breathe underwater.
words.example: He would have drowned if the sailors would not have rescued him.

words.definition: A dynasty is a series of rulers who are all from the same family.
words.example: The Ming dynasty ruled China for many years.

words.definition: A fraction is a small part of something.
words.example: Only a fraction of the students passed the test.

words.definition: Frost is a thin layer of ice that forms on surfaces when it is cold.
words.example: The grass was covered with frost in the morning.

words.definition: An illusion is something that looks real but is not.
words.example: The magician created an illusion of a floating person.

words.definition: To invade a country is to enter it with an army to take control.
words.example: The army was planning to invade the neighboring country.

words.definition: A lieutenant is an officer in the army or navy.
words.example: The lieutenant led the soldiers into battle.

words.definition: If something is marine, it is related to the sea.
words.example: He is studying marine biology.

words.definition: A merit is a quality or achievement that deserves praise.
words.example: He was given a reward for his merit.

words.definition: A navy is the part of a country's military that fights at sea.
words.example: He joined the navy after high school.

words.definition: If something is polar, it is related to the North or South Pole.
words.example: Polar bears live in the Arctic.

words.definition: A ray is a line of light or energy.
words.example: A ray of sunlight came through the window.

words.definition: To resign is to leave your job.
words.example: He resigned from his job after five years.

words.definition: Suicide is the act of killing yourself.
words.example: He was very sad and committed suicide.

words.definition: To tremble is to shake, especially because you are cold or scared.
words.example: She was trembling with fear.

words.definition: If something is underlying, it is the main cause or reason for something else.
words.example: Stress was the underlying cause of his illness.

words.definition: Via means through or by way of.
words.example: We traveled to Paris via London.
